header.div: Read this sample answer to the Writing Task in Exercise 7 and find the mistakes. There are 10 and they may be factual, grammatical or lexical errors. Click on them.

div.p: The chart shows the number of Internet users among the female population of the United States in 2000 and 2001. As is perhaps to be expected, there was a higher proportion of Internet users among younger age groups than older age groups. This was true for both years, but the trend was slightly less pronounced in 2001 as Internet use rise steadily across nearly all age groups.

In 2000, there was a clear upward trend in the proportion of the female population who used the Internet as age increased. The percentage was at its highest with the 12 to 15-year-olds. Between the ages of 16 and 55, the percentage fell steady, but from the age of 55 onwards the figures fluctuated. The percentage for women in the 65+ age group, for example, was less than a third of that for the 46 to 55-year-olds.

Turning to 2001, there was a marked peak in the proportion of Internet users for nearly all age groups of women. Most notably, the percentage of users in the 65+ age group nearly tripled and the proportion in the 36 to 55 age groups also rose sharp. There was a dramatical increase in the proportion of users in the 16 to 18-year-old age group, reaching almost 100 per cent. Interestingly, however, there was a slight plunge in the figure for the very youngest age group.
Overall, it can be said that, among the female population of the United States, Internet use became more common and more evenly distributed across age groups between 2000 and 2001.

section.p: You should spend about 20 minutes on this task.

p.b: The chart shows trends in the use of the Internet by the female population of the USA.
Write a report for a university lecturer describing the information shown below.

section.p: You should write at least 150 words.
percentage: The vertical axis shows percentages.
rose: The past simple tense is needed.
downward: Older age groups use the Internet less.
increase: A peak is a rise to the highest point followed by a fall.
doubled: from 18 per cent to nearly 30 per cent
sharply: The adverb is needed, not the adjective.
dramatic: This is the correct form of the adjective.
fall: A plunge can never be described as 'slight'.
